Message.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Message.Issue: Object 'allTarFileStream' can be disposed more than once in method 'ConfigParser.CreateZips()'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 606

Object 'tarFileStream' can be disposed more than once in method 'ConfigParser.CreateZips()'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 602

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on 'LegacyTarWriter' or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.
Modify 'LegacyTarWriter.Dispose()' so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 606

Rule.Name: Implement IDisposable correctly
Rule.Description: All IDisposable types should implement the Dispose pattern correctly.
Rule.Resolution: Modify {0} so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on {0} or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.
